name: Hack.UVA + Hackathons
descriptions: Currently, I am the treasurer of Hack.UVA, handling our finances and account. I was an organizer for Hack.UVA Spring 2017, lining up all caterers and contacted 65+ sponsors.

So far, I've participated in 10 hackathons — PilotDC 2014, PilotDC 2015, HackTJ 2015, HackUMBC 2016, Bitcamp 2016, MLH Prime Spring 2016, YHacks 2016, MHacks Nano 2017, RamHacks 2017, and HoyaHacks 2018. I placed first in two category prizes at RamHacks 2017 and second in a third.
I've mentored at two middle school hackathons — leading an App Inventor workshop in HackCL 2016 and working with a group of 3 at FirstHack 2016.

name: Natural Language Processing Research Group
descriptions: Under Professor Kai Wei Chang, I dived into natural language processing and deep learning with other students, ranging from undergrad to PhD. Being a part of this research group entailed weekly meetings for delving into new papers and technologies. On my own, I have been listening to online machine learning and natural language processing lectures (Coursera and Stanford) and have been programming small projects along the way. There are some fascinating problems and applications in this field from what I've learned so far; I've still got a lot I want to explore.

name: Music Program
descriptions: I was elected Chief Technology Officer of Cavalier Symphony Orchestra (CSO), for which I am developing a website. Even in its germinal stages, the website has already successfully garnered interest and provide an easy avenue for registration in the orchestra.
This will be my eleveth year playing trumpet and my second year playing in CSO and in the First Year Players pit orchestra at UVA.

name: Rubik's Cube Club
descriptions: I was elected co-president as four-year member of my high school's Rubik's Cube club. My responsibilities included recruiting members, developing the website, and maintaining the mailing list.
On a fun note, I participated on the competitive team that solved 25 cubes in national record time.

name: STEMBassadors
descriptions: Through my high school outreach program, I tutored math for Holmes Middle School sixth grade students considered at risk of failing the state mandated math exam.
